captions.text:
[MUSIC PLAYING]
(SINGING) Everything

you do it sends me
higher than the moon.
- Hey everyone.

I'm Mindy from Cute
Girls Hairstyles.

And today I'm here
with Camry, and we're

going to show you how to
do a waterfall rope twist.

Now, one of the best
parts about this hairstyle

is that I think it looks just
as beautiful whether you start

with your hair wet or dry,
which is perfect for summertime

when you're climbing in and out
of the water, and at the pool,

and at the beach,
and everything else.
So, let's go get started.

OK now, for this
hairstyle, you're

actually taking two
techniques I taught you

before, a waterfall
twist and a rope braid

and combining the
two of them together
to create one awesome hairstyle.

So, if I'm going too fast in
this video, for any reason,

you can always check out
the individual videos

for a little bit
slower technique.

I'm going to start by parting
her hair on the left side,

and then I'm going to go over
to heavy side of her hair,

and pick up a section
right here in front.

I'm going to divide this
section into two pieces.

And I'm going to
take the bottom piece

and just cross it
over the top piece.
Easy at that.

Now I'm going to take some
hair from the top, a little
strand right here.

I'm going to take
it and put it right

through the middle
of those two pieces.

And then I'm going to
twist the hair again.

So, you basically just
created a little pocket area
for that strand.

Now I'm going to
pick up hair again.

Again, take it right through
the middle of the two pieces
and twist it.

And you're just
going to repeat this

all the way towards
the back of her head.

And I am going to angle it just
down slightly as I go along.

And, we're nearly
finished with this part.

You're probably going
to get, I don't know,

five, six maybe seven
strands falling through

before you're going
to want to quit.
So, I'm going to stop there.

I'm just going to twist
it a couple more times
to secure it all.

And then you can
either secure it

like clip it out of the way
with a little hair clip,
or you can elastic it.

I'm just going to have her hang
onto it, for one second for me,

with this hand please
on your left side.
Thank you.

Now, I'm going to
swoop all of her hair
over to that same shoulder.

So, I'm just going to
go back and make sure
I gather up all this hair.

Swoop it over to the side
because I want it hanging over

this shoulder where we have
the pretty waterfall effect.

And when I get it, kind
of placed where I want,

then I'm going to
divide the hair in half.

Now I'm going to have
her release the twist

and I'm just going
to add them right
into one of those two pieces.
For me, I like the back one.

Now, we're going to
take these two pieces

and we are going
to rope twist them.

So let's do that, we're
going to just twist
this very softly to the right.

Can you hold that
for me for a sec?

Now, you're going
to take this one
and also twist it to the right.

Now, I'm going to just
twist them together
going towards the left.

And this is creating
a rope twist

that's going to
stay in securely.

So when I leg go of it, it's
not going to fall apart.
Like a normal twist might.

When you get down to the end,
security it with an elastic.
Go ahead and let it go.

And then you can loosen it
if you want a little softer
look right at the top.
And, there you have it.

This great water
falling effect, and I

love that it goes
right into the twist.
And it's all there on one side.

So let's give her
the final spin.

You can see, I love
this effect into it.

And then it's just a soft
side pony tail from the back
and from the other side.
Perfect.
Great summer do.

Keeps the hair out of
your face on those days.
And it looks great wet or dry.

You can't ask for
anything more than that.

Now, if you guys are still
watching my mom minutes,
be sure to check this one out.

It's on family hardships
and surviving it

when your family's
having a tough time.

I put the link up here
or description box
below so you can check it out.

And we'll see you
guys next Sunday.

Bye guys. -Bye. [MUSIC PLAYING]
(SINGING) Hard to ignore.

Whenever little thing
you do I do adore.

Which means you're
not going to get maybe

your favorite pair of
jeans or, you know,

be able to do the sports or
activities that you're used to.

That's probably just
a temporary thing so

try not to be to
[MUSIC PLAYING] Hello.
Say hi.
Hello.
My name is Brady.

And I'm from Cute
Girls Hairstyles.

title: Waterfall Twist Rope Braid | Summer Hairstyles
